Kemudian beliau mengangkat kedua belah tangannya berdoa dan menangis lagi dan air matanya membasahi tanah. Setelah Bilal datang untuk azan subuh dan melihat Nabi saw menangis ia bertanya, "Wahai Rasulullah! Mengapakah Rasulullah menangis, padahal Allah telah mengampuni dosa Rasulullah baik yang terdahulu maupun yang akan datang?" Nabi menjawab, "Apakah saya ini bukan seorang hamba yang pantas dan layak bersyukur kepada Allah? Dan bagaimana saya tidak menangis? Pada malam ini Allah telah menurunkan ayat kepadaku. Selanjutnya beliau berkata, "Alangkah rugi dan celakanya orang-orang yang membaca ini dan tidak memikirkan dan merenungkan kandungan artinya."

Memikirkan pergantian siang dan malam, mengikuti terbit dan terbenamnya matahari, siang lebih lama dari malam dan sabaliknya. Semuanya itu menunjukkan atas kebesaran dan kekuasaan penciptanya bagi orang-orang yang berakal. Memikirkan terciptanya langit dan bumi, pergantian siang dan malam secara teratur dengan menghasilkan waktu-waktu tertentu bagi kehidupan manusia merupakan satu tantangan tersendiri bagi kaum intelektual beriman. Mereka diharapkan dapat menjelaskan secara akademik fenomena alam itu, sehingga dapat diperoleh kesimpulan bahwa Tuhan tidaklah menciptakan semua fenomena itu dengan sia-sia.
text.191:
Salah satu ciri khas bagi orang berakal yang merupakan sifat khusus manusia dan kelengkapan ini dinilai sebagai makhluk yang memiliki keunggulan dibanding makhluk lain, yaitu apabila ia memperhatikan sesuatu, selalu memperoleh manfaat dan faedah, ia selalu menggambarkan kebesaran Allah, mengingat dan mengenang kebijaksanaan, keutamaan dan banyaknya nikmat Allah kepadanya. Ia selalu mengingat Allah di setiap waktu dan keadaan, baik pada waktu ia berdiri, duduk atau berbaring. Tidak ada satu waktu dan keadaan dibiarkan berlalu begitu saja, kecuali diisi dan digunakannya untuk memikirkan tentang penciptaan langit dan bumi. Memikirkan keajaiban-keajaiban yang terdapat di dalamnya, yang menggambarkan kesempurnaan alam dan kekuasaan Allah.

Dengan berulang-ulang direnungkan hal-hal tersebut secara mendalam, sesuai dengan sabda Nabi saw, "Pikirkan dan renungkanlah segala sesuatu yang mengenai makhluk Allah, dan jangan sekali-kali kamu memikirkan dan merenungkan tentang zat dan hakikat penciptanya, karena bagaimanapun juga kamu tidak akan sampai dan tidak akan dapat mencapai hakikat Zat-Nya.

Akhirnya setiap orang yang berakal akan mengambil kesimpulan dan berkata, "Ya Tuhan kami, tidaklah Engkau menciptakan ini semua, yaitu langit dan bumi serta segala isinya dengan sia-sia, tidak mempunyai hikmah yang mendalam dan tujuan tertentu yang akan membahagiakan kami di dunia dan di akhirat. Mahasuci Engkau Ya Allah dari segala sangkaan yang bukan-bukan yang ditujukan kepada Engkau, maka peliharalah kami dari siksa api neraka yang telah disediakan bagi orang-orang yang tidak beriman.

Penciptaan langit dan bumi serta pergantian malam dan siang, sungguh merupakan fenomena yang sangat kompleks, yang terus menerus menjadi obyek penelitian umat manusia, sejak awal lahirnya peradaban manusia. 

Dalam beberapa surah, antara lain Surah al-Araf/7 ayat 54, disebutkan bahwa penciptaan langit dan bumi berlangsung dalam waktu enam masa (lihat pula Telaah Ilmiah Surah al-Araf/7:54). 

Begitu kompleksnya penciptaan langit dan bumi yang berlangsung dalam enam masa telah dijelaskan oleh Dr.Achmad Marconi (lihat: Bagaimana Alam Semesta Diciptakan, Pendekatan al-Qur'an dan Sains Modern, Pustaka Jaya, 2003) sebagai berikut: Kata ayyam adalah bentuk jamak dari yaum. Kata yaum dalam arti sehari-hari dipakai untuk menunjukkan keadaan terangnya siang, ditafsirkan sebagai 'masa. Sedang bentuk jamaknya: ayyam, dapat berarti 'beberapa hari dan bahkan dapat berarti 'waktu yang lama. Dilihat dari penggunaan kata ayyam pada ayat di atas menunjukkan sifat relatif waktu dengan memperbandingkan waktu manusia dengan waktu yang berlaku bagi gerak energi-materi alam semesta. Oleh Abdullah Yusuf Ali, (The Holy Qur'an, Text, Translation and Commentary,1934), kata yaum (bentuk tunggal dari ayyam) disetarakan dengan kata dalam bahasa Inggris age atau aeon. Oleh Abdus Suud, ahli tafsir abad ke-16, kata yaum disetarakan dengan pengertian "peristiwa" atau naubat. Lebih tepat bila kata yaum diterjemahkan sebagai "tahap" atau periode atau masa. Dengan demikian kalimat fi sittati ayyam dalam ayat-54 Surah al-Araf/7 di atas, tepat untuk diterjemahkan sebagai 'dalam enam masa. 

Marconi (2003) menjelaskan keenam masa tersebut adalah: Masa Pertama, Sejak 'Dentuman Besar (Big Bang) dari Singularity, sampai terpisahnya Gaya Gravitasi dari Gaya Tunggal (Superforce), ruang-waktu mulai memisah. Namun Kontinuum Ruang-Waktu yang lahir masih berujud samar-samar, di mana energi-materi dan ruang-waktu tidak jelas bedanya. Masa Kedua, massa terbentuknya inflasi Jagad Raya, namun Jagad Raya ini masih belum jelas bentuknya, dan disebut sebagai Cosmic Soup (Sup Kosmos). Gaya Nuklir-Kuat memisahkan diri dari Gaya Elektro-Lemah, serta mulai terbentuknya materi-materi fundamental: quarks, antiquarks, dsb. Jagad Raya mulai mengembang. Masa Ketiga, masa terbentuknya inti-inti atom di Jagad Raya ini. Gaya Nuklir-Lemah mulai terpisah dari Gaya Elektromagnetik. Inti-inti atom seperti proton, netron, dan meson tersusun dari quark-quark ini. Masa ini dikenal sebagai masa pembentukan inti-inti atom (Nucleosyntheses). Ruang, waktu serta materi dan energi, mulai terlihat terpisah. Masa Keempat, elektron-elektron mulai terbentuk, namun masih dalam keadaan bebas, belum terikat oleh inti-atom untuk membentuk atom yang stabil. Masa Kelima, terbentuknya atom-atom yang stabil, memisahnya materi dan radiasi, dan Jagad Raya, terus mengembang dan mulai nampak transparan. Masa Keenam, Jagad raya terus mengembang, atom-atom mulai membentuk aggregat menjadi molekul-molekul, makro-molekul, kemudian membentuk proto-galaksi, galaksi-galaksi, bintang-bintang, tata surya-tata surya, dan planet-planet.

Demikian pula silih bergantinya malam dan siang, merupakan fenomena yang sangat kompleks. Fenomena ini melibatkan 'rotasi bumi (yaitu bumi berputar pada sumbunya), seraya 'mengelilingi matahari dengan sumbu bumi miring. Dalam fenomena fisika bumi berkitar (precession) mengelilingi matahari. Jadi silih bergantinya malam dan siang terjadi karena adanya gerakan rotasi bumi yang berkitar mengelilingi sebuah bintang, yaitu matahari. Karena gerakannya miring, gerakan perkitaran bumi mengelilingi matahari juga memberikan dampak musim yang berbeda-beda, tergantung dari posisi tempat di bumi terhadap matahari. Selain itu rotasi bumi dalam berkitar mengelilingi matahari, distabilkan oleh bulan yang berputar mengelilingi bumi, dalam istilah astronomi, bulan memberikan rotational dynamic stability pada rotasi bumi yang berkitar mengelilingi matahari. Planet-planet lain yang juga mengelilingi matahari, memberikan pula rotational dinamic stability kepada perkitaran bumi terhadap matahari, Subhanallah! Terbukti bahwa eksistensi bulan sangat diperlukan agar precession (perkitaran) bumi pada sumbunya stabil. Bulan memberikan kestabilan dalam dimensi waktu 10-100 tahun, sedang Venus dan Mars memberikan kestabilan dalam dimensi waktu 100-500 tahun. Sedang planet Jupiter dan Saturnus, juga ikut memberikan rotational dynamic stability terhadap bumi kita ini, selain juga bertindak sebagai shield (perisai) bagi bumi terhadap hamburan meteor yang akan membentur bumi (komunikasi personal dengan Prof. Dr. Ir. Said D. Jenie, pakar Mekanika Benda Langit ITB)(lihat juga Telaah Ilmiah Surah al-Anam, ayat 96).

Jelaslah, begitu kompleksnya fenomena ciptaan Allah swt. tentang 'Penciptaan Langit dan Bumi, serta silih bergantinya malam dan siang ini. Hanya para ilmuwan dan filosof yang sangat ulung dan tekun serta tawadhu, yang akan mampu menyingkap rahasia alam ini. Merekalah yang disebut sebagai Ulil Albab pada ayat di atas. Penciptaan Langit dan Bumi sangat kompleks, dan baru 'sedikit yang diketahui manusia tentang itu. Silih bergantinya malam pun juga sangat kompleks. Dalam era modern ini, ilmu pengetahuan telah mampu menyingkap bahwa bulan, planet Venus, Mars, Jupiter, dan Saturnus, semuanya memberikan pengaruh berupa rotational dynamic stability pada rotasi bumi dalam berkitar mengelilingi matahari itu. Mereka inilah (para ulil albab) yang sampai kepada kesimpulan: "Ya Tuhan kami, tiadalah Engkau menciptakan ini dengan sia-sia. Maha Suci Engkau, maka peliharalah kami dari siksa neraka".
text.192: Ya Allah, Ya Tuhan kami, kami mohon dengan penuh khusyuk dan rendah hati, agar kami ini benar-benar dijauhkan dari api neraka, api yang akan membakar hangus orang-orang yang angkuh dan sombong di dunia ini, yang tidak mau menerima yang hak dan benar yang datang dari Engkau Pencipta seluruh alam. Kami tahu bahwa orang-orang yang Engkau masukkan ke dalam neraka, adalah orang-orang yang sungguh-sungguh telah Engkau hinakan karena kezaliman dan kekafiran yang telah mereka lakukan di dunia ini. Mereka terus-menerus merasakan siksa neraka itu, karena tidaklah ada bagi orang-orang yang zalim dan kafir itu seorang penolong pun, yang dapat mengeluarkan mereka dari kepedihan siksa yang dialaminya.
text.193:
Setelah mengucapkan doa yang didasarkan kepada tafakur dan renungan tentang alam dan segala keajaibannya seperti tersebut di atas, maka disusul lagi dengan doa yang menggambarkan perhatian pada panggilan yang didengarnya. Ya Allah kami telah mendengar seruan Rasul-Mu, yang menyeru agar kami beriman kepada-Mu dan membenarkan firman-Mu, maka segera kami beriman, melakukan segala perintah-Mu, menjauhi segala larangan-Mu, sesuai dengan anjuran yang dibawa oleh Rasul-Mu.

Oleh karena itu ampunilah dosa-dosa yang telah kami lakukan dan hapuskanlah dari kami dosa-dosa kecil yang pernah kami perbuat, serta matikanlah kami di dalam keadaan husnul-khatimah, bersama-sama dengan orang-orang baik yang banyak berbuat kebajikan.
text.194:
Ya Tuhan kami! Kami telah melaksanakan segala perintah-Mu. Kami selalu mengingat-Mu setiap waktu dan setiap keadaan. Kami telah memenuhi seruan Rasul-Mu. Oleh karena itu, ya Tuhan kami, berikanlah kepada kami apa-apa yang telah Engkau janjikan dengan perantaraan rasul-rasul. Engkau telah menjanjikan kekuasaan di dunia ini dengan firman Engkau:

Allah telah menjanjikan kepada orang-orang di antara kamu yang beriman dan yang mengerjakan kebajikan, bahwa Dia sungguh, akan menjadikan mereka berkuasa di bumi, ¦.(an-Nur/24:55).

Engkau telah menjanjikan kemenangan dan pertolongan bagi orang yang taat dan menjunjung tinggi agama Engkau, dengan firman-Mu:

¦. Jika kamu menolong (agama) Allah, niscaya Dia akan menolongmu ¦.. (Muhammad/47:7).

Kemudian dalam ayat yang lain Allah berfirman:

Allah menjanjikan kepada orang-orang mukmin laki-laki dan perempuan, (akan mendapat) surga yang mengalir di bawahnya sungai-sungai,¦ (at-Taubah/9:72).

Hal-hal tersebut di atas merupakan kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat yang sangat kami harapkan dan jangan sekali-kali Engkau hinakan kami pada hari kiamat sesuai dengan firman Engkau:

¦ Pada hari ketika Allah tidak mengecewakan Nabi dan orang-orang yang beriman bersama dengannya¦ (at-Tahrim/66:8).

Semua ini kami mohon dengan segala kerendahan hati, untuk memantapkan pengamalan kami atas segala perintah-Mu, karena dengan demikian kami akan memperoleh kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat, dan bukan sekali-kali tidak ragu atas segala janji-Mu, karena kami percaya dengan penuh keyakinan bahwa Engkau tidak akan menyalahi janji sedikit pun.
text.195:
Ummi Salamah pernah berkata, "Ya Rasulullah! Saya tidak mendengar Allah menyebut-nyebut perempuan sedikit pun yang berkenaan dengan hijrah." Maka turunlah ayat ini. Atas ketekunan mereka beramal baik, penuh dengan keikhlasan yang dibarengi doa yang sungguh-sungguh, maka Allah memperkenankan permohonan mereka. 

Dijelaskan bahwa Allah tidak akan menyia-nyiakan amal seseorang yang taat dan tidak akan membeda-bedakan antara laki-laki dan perempuan dalam memberi pahala dan balasan, karena kedua jenis ini satu sama lain turun menurunkan, perempuan berasal dari laki-laki dan begitu juga sebaliknya. Oleh karena itu barang siapa hijrah, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan, diusir dari kampung halamannya, disiksa karena ia tekun di jalan Allah, memerangi musuh-musuh Allah yang akhirnya mati syahid, tewas di medan perang, pasti Allah akan menghapuskan segala kesalahannya, mengampuni dosanya dan pasti pula akan masukkan ke dalam surga, merupakan pahala dan balasan dari Dia, sebagai perwujudan doa dari permohonan yang diperkenankan-Nya. Alangkah berbahagia mereka, memperoleh pahala dan balasan dari Allah, karena memang pahala dan balasan yang sebaik-baiknya ialah yang datang dari Allah swt.
text.196:
Meskipun ayat ini ditujukan kepada Nabi Muhammad saw namun dimaksudkan pula untuk umatnya, sebagaimana kita lihat banyak ayat yang menurut bunyinya ditujukan kepada Nabi saw, tetapi pada hakikatnya ditujukan pula kepada semua pengikutnya. Nabi Muhammad saw selama hidupnya tidak pernah teperdaya oleh bujukan dan tipuan siapa pun, sebagaimana yang diriwayatkan oleh Qatadah, ia berkata, "Demi Allah mereka tidak pernah berhasil memperdayakan Nabi saw sampai beliau wafat."

Dari ayat ini dapat dipahami bahwa kaum Muslimin tidak boleh teperdaya oleh kehidupan mewah orang-orang kafir yang tujuan hidupnya hanyalah mencari kekayaan dunia semata.

Kaum Muslimin hendaklah tabah dan sabar menghadapi hal yang seperti ini dan tetap berjuang untuk kebahagiaan di dunia dan di akhirat, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Dan carilah (pahala) negeri akhirat dengan apa yang telah dianugerahkan Allah kepadamu, tetapi janganlah kamu lupakan bagianmu di dunia dan berbuat baiklah (kepada orang lain) sebagaimana Allah telah berbuat baik kepadamu, dan janganlah kamu berbuat kerusakan di bumi. Sungguh, Allah tidak menyukai orang yang berbuat kerusakan. (al-Qasas/28:77).
text.197:
Orang mukmin tidak perlu cemas, tidak perlu berkecil hati melihat kemewahan yang diperoleh orang kafir, musuh Tuhan itu, karena yang demikian adalah kesenangan yang tidak banyak berarti dibanding dengan pahala dan kesenangan yang disediakan untuk orang mukmin di akhirat nanti. Nabi Muhammad bersabda:

"Perbandingan hidup di dunia dengan hidup di akhirat hanyalah seperti jari tangan seseorang yang dimasukkan di dalam laut." (Riwayat Muslim).

Air yang menempel di jari, itulah dunia, dan air laut itulah akhirat. Hidup di dunia hanya sementara, karena mereka bersenang-senang hanya selama hidup saja, kemudian setelah meninggal, mereka akan ditempatkan di tempat yang seburuk-buruknya.
text.198:
Berbeda dengan kaum kafir yang akan ditempatkan di dalam neraka, maka di akhirat nanti orang-orang yang bertakwa, yaitu orang-orang yang mengamalkan perintah-perintah Allah, meninggalkan segala larangan-Nya, akan ditempatkan di dalam surga, kekal untuk selama-lamanya. 

Alangkah bahagianya mereka, karena apa yang di sisi Allah itu adalah yang sebaik-baiknya bagi orang yang berbakti. Jauh lebih baik daripada kesenangan dan kemewahan yang dirasakan orang-orang kafir di dunia, karena sifatnya terbatas, yaitu selama hidup di dunia saja. Rasulullah memberi contoh nyata seperti yang disampaikan Umar bin al-Khattab r.a. berkata:

"Saya berkunjung kepada Rasulullah saw, waktu itu beliau berada dalam sebuah ruangan, tidur di atas tikar yang tidak beralas. Di bawah kepalanya bantal dari kulit kambing yang diisi dengan sabut. Pada kedua kakinya daun penyamak terkumpul. Di alas kepalanya, kulit kambing tergantung. Saya melihat bekas tikar pada dua lambungnya, maka saya menangis. Beliau berkata, "Apa yang menyebabkan engkau menangis?" Saya menjawab, "Wahai Rasulullah, Kisra dan Kaisar selalu di dalam kesenangan, kemewahan dan serba cukup dan Engkau adalah Rasulullah dan dalam keadaan begini?" Rasulullah menjawab, "Apakah Engkau tidak senang, bahwa dunia ini bagi mereka dan akhirat bagi kita" (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim).
text.199:
Jabir bin Abdullah, Anas, Ibnu Abbas, Qatadah dan al-hasan berkata bahwa ayat ini diturunkan tentang an-Najasyi, raja bangsa Habasyi yang telah masuk Islam ketika meninggal. Malaikat Jibril memberitahu Nabi saw, maka Nabi berkata kepada sahabatnya, "Marilah kita (salat gaib) untuk an-Najasyi itu." Sebagian sahabat dengan penuh keheranan bertanya, "Kenapa kami disuruh salat untuk orang kafir di negeri Habsyi?" Maka turunlah ayat ini.

Tidaklah semua Ahli Kitab itu menyimpang dari ajaran Allah, berkhianat, mengingkari kebenaran yang dibawa oleh Nabi Muhammad saw, tetapi ada sebagian dari mereka seperti an-Najasyi, Abdullah bin Salam dan lain-lain, mempunyai sejarah gemilang dalam hidupnya. Mereka benar-benar beriman kepada Allah, percaya kepada Al-Qur'an yang diturunkan kepada Rasulullah saw, begitu pula kitab-kitab samawi yang diturunkan kepada nabi-nabi, mereka taat dan rendah diri kepada Allah, tidak menukar ayat-ayat Allah dengan harga yang sedikit, maksudnya tidak menyembunyikan apa yang mereka ketahui tentang kedatangan Nabi Muhammad saw sebagai Rasul. Mereka adalah Ahli Kitab yang baik dan lurus, baik ia Yahudi maupun ia Nasrani. Mereka akan memperoleh pahala di sisi Tuhan sebagaimana yang telah dijanjikan dengan firman-Nya:

Mereka itu diberi pahala dua kali (karena beriman kepada Taurat dan Al-Qur'an) disebabkan kesabaran mereka, ¦. (al-Qasas/28:54)

Sesungguhnya Allah amat cepat perhitungan-Nya karena segala sesuatunya diketahui-Nya dengan jelas, baik pahala yang akan diberikan-Nya maupun orang yang berhak menerimanya.
text.200:
Setelah membicarakan berbagai macam hikmah dan hukum sejak awal surah ini, maka untuk menjaga dan memantapkan pelaksanaan hal-hal tersebut, surah ini (Ali 'Imran) ditutup dengan anjuran agar orang beriman, sabar dan tabah melakukan segala macam perintah Allah, mengatasi semua gangguan dan cobaan, menghindari segala larangan-Nya, terutama bersabar dan tabah menghadapi lawan-lawan dan musuh agama. Jangan sampai musuh-musuh agama itu lebih sabar dan tabah dari kita sehingga kemenangan berada di pihak mereka. Hendaklah orang mukmin selalu bersiap siaga dengan segala macam cara dan upaya, berjihad, menghadapi kemungkinan-kemungkinan yang akan mengurangi kewibawaan dan kemurnian serta keagungan agama Islam. Dan sebagai sari patinya orang mukmin dianjurkan agar benar-benar bertakwa kepada Allah dengan sebenar-benar takwa di mana saja mereka berada, karena dengan bekal takwa itulah segala sesuatu dapat dilaksanakan dengan baik, diberkahi, dan diridai oleh Allah swt.

Demikianlah, barang siapa di antara orang-orang yang beriman melaksanakan 4 macam anjuran tersebut, pasti akan mendapat kemenangan dan kebahagiaan, di dunia dan di akhirat.

text.1: Alif Lam Mim belongs to the *huruf-huruf muqaththa'ah* (abbreviated letters) that are located at the beginning of several surahs of the Qur'an. The *mufasirun* have differing opinions regarding the meaning of these letters; further information on this matter can be found under the title "Fawatihus-suwar" at the beginning of Volume I of this *tafsir*.
text.2: This verse affirms that the God who has the right to be worshipped is none other than Allah swt, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of all that exists. See further the commentary on verse 255 of al-Baqarah.
text.3:
This verse explains that the God who deserves to be worshipped truly sent down the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) through the intermediary of Jibril (Gabriel), and affirms that before sending down the Qur'an, Allah had also sent down books to the previous prophets, who were sent before the coming of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), for example, the Torah was sent down to the Prophet Musa (Moses), the Gospel was sent down to the Prophet Isa (Jesus), and so on.

The Qur'an acknowledges the truth of the contents of the previous books, just as the previous books confirmed the contents of the Qur'an in accordance with what those books indicated. This affirmation and acknowledgement is only in general terms, not in detail, namely that Allah sent messengers to the previous communities, and Allah sent down revelation to them, such as the Torah, the Gospel, and so on. The contents of those books are not explained by the Qur'an. Believing in the affirmation and acknowledgement of that verse is part of faith in Allah.

Just as the Qur'an acknowledges that prophets and messengers were sent to previous communities and that books were revealed to them, so too did the previous books indicate and acknowledge that at the end of time Allah would send a final prophet, the seal of the prophets, and to that prophet Allah would also send down a book containing the core principles of the message brought by the previous prophets.

According to this verse, the entire contents of the Torah and the Gospel are revelations from Allah, conveyed to the Prophet Musa and the Prophet Isa, containing the core principles of the message they brought, and there is not the slightest trace in them of human composition or anything of the sort.

Regarding the Torah that exists now, it is not the Torah that was revealed to the Prophet Musa, and likewise the Gospel is not the Gospel that was revealed to the Prophet Isa, because in both books there are writings by the followers of the two Prophets who came later.

¦. They distort the words (of Allah) from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a good portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. ¦ (al-Ma'idah/5:13. See also an-Nisa'/4:46).
text.4:
Before the Quran was revealed, the Torah and the Gospel served as guidance for mankind, and then Al-Furqan, which is the Quran, was revealed, a book that can distinguish between right and wrong.

At the end of this verse, Allah threatens with a severe punishment those who remain in disbelief and are unwilling to acknowledge the books that Allah has revealed to the messengers, those who are unwilling to use their intellect to distinguish between true and false beliefs, between religions that are pleasing to Allah and those that are not. They will all be cast into Hell. Nothing can change Allah's decision, and no one can escape or defend themselves from His punishment. Allah will recompense all forms of disbelief and disobedience to His laws and punish the perpetrators with a fitting punishment.
text.5: Allah's knowledge encompasses everything; nothing is comparable to Allah's knowledge, and nothing escapes His awareness.
text.6: By His power, He created mankind in various forms after going through process after process, starting from a sperm cell that penetrates the womb, then becoming something that clings to the wall of the womb, and from that clinging thing becoming a lump of clinging flesh, finally taking the form of a human being and being born into the world (al-Mu'minun/23:12-14). All of that was created by Allah in accordance with His sunnah (law) and knowledge.
text.7:
The Qur'an, which Allah revealed, contains verses that are muhkamat and verses that are mutasyabihat.

"Ayat muhkamat" are verses that are clear in meaning, such as verses related to laws, and so on. "Ayat mutasyabihat" are verses that are not clear in meaning, which can be interpreted in various ways. Such as verses related to unseen matters, and so on.

According to some mufassir (Quran commentators), the purpose of revealing these verses is:

1. To test the faith and steadfastness of a Muslim to Allah. True faith should be accompanied by complete surrender to Allah in the broadest sense. Allah revealed verses that can be easily understood and He revealed verses that are difficult to know the true meaning and intent of, namely ayat mutasyabihat. In facing these ayat mutasyabihat, humans will feel that they are not perfect beings, they are only given a little knowledge by Allah, therefore they will surrender the understanding of these verses to Allah, the All-Knowing.

2. With the existence of ayat muhkamat and mutasyabihat, Muslims will think according to the limits given by Allah; some can be thought about deeply and some are difficult to think about, then surrendered to Allah.

3. The prophets and messengers were sent to all of mankind who are different, for example: different in intelligence, ability, wealth, and also different in nation, language and region. Therefore, the way of conveying religion to them should be adjusted to their circumstances and the readiness of the language they possess according to their abilities.

The attitude of humans in understanding and facing ayat mutasyabihat, namely:

1. People whose hearts do not desire the truth, they use these verses as material for slander that they spread among people and they seek out meanings that can be used as reasons to strengthen their opinions and desires.

2. People who have deep knowledge and want to seek the truth, they must seek the correct understanding from that verse. If they are not yet or unable to know it, they surrender to Allah while praying and asking for guidance.

At the end of this verse, Allah explains the characteristics of people who are deep in knowledge, namely people who like to pay attention to Allah's creation, like to think about and contemplate it. He thinks solely for Allah and to seek the truth.
text.8: The attitude of those whose knowledge is profound is that they always pray and surrender themselves to Allah swt, when they are no longer able to contemplate the verses of Allah. They pray to Allah to always be protected, guided, given direction, and that they may not slip into the wrong path after they have received guidance. From their prayers, it is understood that what they ask for is not merely worldly safety and happiness, but they also ask for happiness and safety in the hereafter.
text.9:
In the prayer of those whose knowledge is profound, their conviction is also reflected, namely, they believe in the coming of the Day of Judgment, and after that, Allah will gather all of His creation to be reckoned for all the deeds they have done during their lives in the world. They believe that on that day, Allah will reward good deeds with manifold rewards, and recompense all sinful deeds with a fitting punishment.

The coming of the Hereafter and the gathering of creation on that day is a promise from Allah to mankind. Those whose knowledge is profound are absolutely certain that Allah will fulfill His promise.
text.10:
Those who disbelieve and deny the prophethood of Muhammad, even though they know the truth, whether from the People of the Book or from the Arab polytheists, will not be able to escape the punishment of Allah. Furthermore, Allah explains that their wealth and offspring will not intercede for them in the slightest. Wealth that can be used to obtain benefits and ward off harm in this world, and children who can help in all important matters and in wars, all of that will not save them from the fire of Hell, as Allah says:

"(It is) the Day when wealth or children will be of no benefit," (ash-Shu'ara'/26:88)

Even if they say as Allah says:

"And they say, "We are more (than you) in wealth and children, and we will not be punished."" (Saba'/34:35)

This statement of theirs is refuted by Allah with His saying:

"And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but [it is] one who believes and does righteousness. ¦" (Saba'/34:37)
text.11:
The situation of those who disbelieve is like the situation of Pharaoh and his followers, and also similar to what previous communities did to Prophet Musa and other prophets. They denied the signs of Allah brought by the messengers. Therefore, Allah sent down punishment upon them, no matter how great their power. The enemies of the prophets were destroyed, and the prophets and their followers achieved victory.

The disbelievers cannot escape the punishment sent down by Allah. Because Allah's punishment is a natural consequence of their own sins. The Jews were afraid of the revelation of this verse because they knew what Pharaoh and his followers had experienced.

The disbelievers referred to in this verse are the Jews of Medina. According to a narration from Ibn 'Abbas, when the Jews of Medina witnessed the victory of the Messenger of Allah over the polytheists in the Battle of Badr, they said, "By Allah, indeed he is the unlettered prophet, whom Prophet Musa informed us about, and in the Torah there are signs of him." Then they intended to follow Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). But some of them said, "Do not rush until you witness other evidence." When the Battle of Uhud arrived, they became doubtful and then they canceled the agreement they had made with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then Ka'ab bin al-Asyraf (the leader of the Jews) along with sixty members of the cavalry set out immediately to Mecca to gather strength to fight the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). So at that time this verse was revealed.

It is also narrated by Abu Dawud in his *Sunan*, and by al-Baihaqi in *Dala'il* through Ibn Ishaq from Ibn 'Abbas that when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) succeeded in defeating the Quraysh in the Battle of Badr, he returned to Medina, he gathered the Jews in the market of Bani Qainuqa'. He said, "O Jews, enter into Islam before you are afflicted by what Allah has afflicted the people of Quraysh with." They replied, "O Muhammad, do not be deceived by yourself. You have killed a number of Quraysh people, and they were inexperienced people, not understanding war. By Allah, if you fight against us, you will know that we are the real men, you have never faced us." With this incident, verses 12 and 13 were revealed.
text.12:
In this verse, Allah firmly warns them; that they will surely be destroyed in this world, before the Hereafter. Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was commanded to say to the Jews that they would be defeated in this world. God will fulfill His promise, and in the Hereafter they will be placed in Hell Jahannam.

The truth of this verse was proven later. The Muslims succeeded in defeating the Jewish tribe of Bani Quraizah because of their betrayal and expelling Bani Nadir from Medina, because of their hypocrisy, and conquering the city of Khaibar, the city of the Jews, as well as collecting jizyah from the Jews. Although this verse explains the collection of jizyah from the Jews, the meaning of this verse includes all disbelievers in general.
text.13:
Furthermore, Allah warns them not to feel strong because of the amount of wealth and power they possess. Because they should learn a lesson from the event of the Battle of Badr.

The large amount of funds and manpower, and the many allies who help, will not guarantee victory in war. The history of warfare in the world proves the fallacy of such an assumption. What happened in the Battle of Badr, where two armies faced each other, the army of the Muslims, small in number, fighting in the way of Allah, was destined to be victorious over the army of the polytheists, which was far greater in number. Those who have sound minds and use them to contemplate all matters that occur, and take lessons from them, will certainly gain many lessons from the event of the Battle of Badr. It turns out that there is another power above all visible powers. That power often strengthens the weak army until it can defeat the strong and large army with the permission of Allah.

Fighting in the way of Allah is the key to victory. If the struggle and war are aimed at defending the truth, protecting religion and its adherents, then the souls of the fighters will find peace in facing the battlefield and can concentrate with all the strength they possess. Because they believe that behind them there is a force that encourages and there is help from Allah. Allah affirms that this help will be given to His servants who strive in His way, as long as they remain steadfast and patient and always remember Allah, and obey the leadership.

In the second Battle of Badr, which took place on the 17th of Ramadan in the 2nd year of Hijriah, the Muslims tried to comply with the provisions of God and the provisions of His Messenger with all the abilities they had, and with a firm determination. They fought with full courage, and with the help of Allah they won the war.

"O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet." (Muhammad/47: 7).

According to historians, the Muslim army in the Battle of Badr numbered 313 people. Consisting of 77 Muhajirin and 236 Ansar. The one holding the flag in the Muhajirin army was Ali bin Abi Thalib, while the flag of the Ansar army was held by Sa'ad bin 'Ubadah. In the Muslim army there were 90 camels and 2 war horses, each ridden by Miqdad bin al-Aswad and Martsad bin Abi Martsad. The number of those killed from the Muslim side was 14 men, consisting of 6 Muhajirin and 8 Ansar. The number of the polytheist army was 950 people, led by 'Utbah bin Rabi'ah, and among them were Abu Sufyan and Abu Jahal. In their army there were one hundred horses, 700 camels, and an uncountable number of weapons.

In the Battle of Badr, the number of Muslim troops was only 313 people. But in the eyes of the polytheists when the war had broken out, the number became many times greater, so that it caused fear in their hearts. Finally, they fled the battlefield. Thus Allah sent down help to the Muslims.

Before the war broke out, the Muslim army looked very small in the eyes of the polytheists, therefore they dared to face and attack the enemy, as happened in the Battle of Badr.

"And [remember] when Allah showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you few in their eyes, that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined. And to Allah do matters return [for decision]." (al-Anfal/8: 44)

With this help, Allah strengthens those whom He wills, and indeed in such help there is a lesson for those who have reason and thought.
text.14:
After the previous verse explained the errors in the views of the disbelievers regarding wealth and children, as well as their deviation from the truth, this verse explains the aspect of their error caused by wealth and children, which they make the focus of their hopes.

It is a mistake for humans to make wealth and children the purpose of their lives. Women, children, gold and silver, vehicles, livestock, and all wealth are pleasing to humans and greatly loved. Actually, it is not forbidden to love these things, because humans cannot avoid loving them. However, very few people understand the badness or danger of it, even though the evidence is quite clear and many show its badness and danger. Sometimes humans like something, even though they know it is bad and useless. Whoever likes something but considers it not good for themselves can free themselves from its influence. Indeed, Allah has made it the nature of humans to love wealth and pleasure. Therefore, Allah makes wealth and pleasure a means of testing a person's faith, whether they will use all their wealth and pleasure for worldly life only, or whether they will use their wealth to achieve Allah's pleasure.

"Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed." (al-Kahf/18: 7)

The objects of human pleasure in detail are as follows:

First: Women (wives), wives are the focus of love and affection. The human soul is always inclined towards the wife, as Allah says in the Qur'an:

"And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought." (ar-Rum/30: 21)

Most of the income of men, obtained with difficulty, is allocated to children and wives. Men are responsible guides for women, because men have the strength and ability to protect them. But loving women excessively has a negative effect on the family, society, and nation, and can also affect the balance of rights and obligations between men and women.

In this verse, loving wives is mentioned before loving children, even though love for wives can fade, while love for children does not; because love for children is rarely excessive as is the case with loving women.

Generally, loving children does not cause problems. In society, it often happens that a man prioritizes love for women by neglecting love for children. Like a man who marries more than one, he pours his love on another wife, gives her a lot of sustenance, while his old wife is neglected. Thus, his children are neglected, because their education is no longer taken care of. Many children of rulers and rich people are morally corrupt because their fathers love other women.

Second: Children, male or female. Love for children is human nature. The same as love for wives because the goal is to continue the lineage.

Children are actually decorations for the household, successors of generations from generation to generation. But they can turn into trials:

"Your wealth and your children are but a trial, ¦" (at-Tagabun/64: 15)

Third: Abundant wealth. Ar-Razi said in his tafsir, "Gold and silver are very desirable, because they are tools for assessing the price of something. The person who owns them is the same as the person who owns everything. To own means to control. To be in control is one of the perfections, and perfection is desired by all humans. Because gold and silver are the most appropriate tools to obtain perfection, they are desired and loved. If something that is loved cannot be obtained except with something else, then that other thing is also loved. Therefore, gold and silver are loved."

Abundant wealth will tempt the hearts of humans and keep them busy all day taking care of it. This will certainly make people forget about God and the afterlife.

"Those who remained behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They want to change the words of Allah. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did Allah say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact], they were not understanding except a little." (al-Fath/48: 11)

Love for wealth has become a bad habit of humans, because wealth is a tool to fulfill desires. Human desires are limitless. So they pursue wealth endlessly. Rasulullah saw said:

"If a human being had a valley full of wealth, he would want a second (another valley). If he had two valleys, he would want a third. Nothing can fill the stomach of the son of Adam except earth. And Allah forgives those who repent to Him." (Narrated by al-Bukhari from Ibn 'Abbas).

Fourth: Horses that are kept in pastures, especially horses that are white on the forehead and legs, so that they appear as a sign. For Arab society, this kind of horse is the best and most beautiful horse. They compete to own it. They are proud of such horses and sometimes compete to buy them at very high prices.

Fifth: Other livestock, such as cows, camels, goats. These animals are included in the wealth of the Bedouin Arabs. Their living needs such as clothing, food, household appliances and so on, are mostly fulfilled from raising these animals. Allah says explaining His blessings:

"And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat. And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them home and when you drive them out to pasture. And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful. And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know." (an-Nahl/16: 5-8).

Sixth: Rice fields are the source of life for humans and animals. Human needs for rice fields exceed their needs for other desirable assets, because rice fields are the source of fulfilling a person's needs.

Thus are the six kinds of wealth that humans enjoy in this world, and are the equipment for their lives, which fulfill all their needs and desires. Satan tempts humans so that they see it as good to love these assets. But humans should realize that all these assets are only for worldly life which is not eternal. It is not right if humans make wealth their ideals and the ultimate goal of life in this mortal world, so that they are prevented from preparing themselves for the real life, namely the eternal life of the hereafter. Is there not a good place of return (Paradise) with Allah? How happy is the human being, if he uses that wealth within the limits of Allah's guidance.
text.15:
In this verse, Allah commands His Messenger to explain to people what is meant by the good abode, so that they are encouraged to do good deeds. Prophet Muhammad is commanded to ask his people whether they would like to be informed about things that are better than all kinds of pleasures mentioned in verse 14. By asking, they will be more interested in giving answers.

The meaning of "better" is the reward that will be obtained by those who are pious, which can be divided into two kinds of blessings:

1. Physical in nature, blessings in the form of indescribable beauty in Paradise, including life partners who are free from all kinds of defects and weaknesses, such as those found in humans in the world, both in terms of appearance and temperament, and so on.

2. Spiritual in nature, Allah's pleasure that is not mixed even slightly with His wrath, and this is the greatest blessing in the Hereafter for those who are pious.

The Messenger of Allah (saw) said:

"Indeed, Allah 'Azza wa Jalla says to the people of Paradise, "O inhabitants of Paradise," they answer, "Labbaika Rabbana Wasa'daika." Allah says, "Are you all satisfied?" They answer, "Why should we not be satisfied? Indeed, You have given us something that You have never given to anyone from Your creation." Then Allah says, "I will give you something better than that?" They say, "O our Lord! What is better than that?" Then Allah answers, "I will bestow upon you My pleasure. Then I will never be angry with you forever." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abi Sa'id al-Khudri).

The inhabitants of Paradise have levels like the situation in the world. Among the people in this world, there are those who cannot understand the importance of divine pleasure, even though divine pleasure encourages them to do good or abandon evil. They only desire physical pleasures as they feel in the world. Among them are those who have high thinking abilities and are able to draw closer to God. They hope for Allah's pleasure and make it the ultimate goal and highest happiness of their lives.

Allah is All-Knowing of the affairs of humans, the contents of their hearts, and all their secrets. Nothing is hidden from Allah. Therefore, He will reward all human deeds according to the degree of their piety.
text.16:
The characteristics of the pious are those whose hearts have tasted the sweetness of faith, those whose tongues tremble with the utterance of this confession of faith when praying and worshipping. They guard themselves from committing disobedience, submit to Allah with humility, and beseech Him, "Our Lord, we have truly believed in what You have revealed to the Messenger with a faith that permeates the depths of our hearts, guides our minds, and controls our bodily actions. So, our Lord, erase our sins with Your forgiveness and keep us away from the torment of Hellfire. Indeed, You are the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful."

The prayer to be protected from the torment of Hellfire is specifically mentioned because whoever is freed from the torment of Hellfire has truly achieved victory and the best place of return. What is meant by faith in the confession of the pious is pure faith, which is manifested in the ability to guard oneself from disobedience and to do many good deeds.

The *ulama salaf* have agreed that what is meant by faith includes belief (*iktikad*), speech, and action. It is this faith that provides guidance to the intellect and actions of humans in accordance with their *fitrah* (natural disposition).
text.17:
In this verse, the characteristics of the believers that distinguish them from others are mentioned. Through these characteristics, they obtain the pleasure of Allah SWT. They possess all these qualities, and each quality has a level of virtue. Thanks to these qualities, they obtain what Allah has promised them. These characteristics are:

1.  Patience (Sabar). The most perfect patience is patience and steadfastness in enduring hardship in carrying out obedience and avoiding Allah's prohibitions. When the passion of lust has flared up, and the soul has submitted to committing immorality, then patience will restrain it. The quality of patience also establishes (strengthens) faith and maintains obedience within the limits set by the Sharia (religious law). Patience is what preserves human dignity in times of difficulty in the world, and protects the rights of people from the interference of greedy people. The quality of patience is a condition for achieving the qualities of honesty, obedience, and istighfar (seeking forgiveness).

2.  Being truthful. Truth is the pinnacle of perfection. Truth and honesty in faith, speech, and intention.

3.  Obedience (Taat). Obedience is diligence in carrying out Allah's commands and avoiding His prohibitions with submission and humility to Allah. Submission and humility are the soul and essence of worship. Without submission and humility, worship becomes empty, like a tree without fruit.

4.  Spending wealth in the way of Allah, both obligatory (wajib) and voluntary (sunnah), because spending wealth for good deeds is highly emphasized and encouraged by religion.

5.  Seeking forgiveness (Istighfar) at the time of sahur, which is the time before dawn breaks near subuh (dawn prayer). This refers to the tahajud prayer at the end of the night, which is the most pleasant time to sleep and difficult to leave. But the soul and heart at that time are very clear and calm. This prayer is followed by reading istighfar and supplication (doa). It is found in the hadith books Sahih Bukhari and Muslim, and in the books of musnad and sunan, narrations from a number of companions.

The Messenger of Allah said:

"Our Lord, the Most Holy and Most High, descends every night to the lowest heaven during the last third of the night. He says, 'Who is praying to Me that I may answer him? Who is asking of Me that I may give him? Who is seeking forgiveness from Me that I may forgive him?'" (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

As for istighfar (seeking forgiveness) that is intended by religion, it is istighfar accompanied by taubat nasuha (sincere repentance), and adjusting actions with the provisions of religion. Taubat nasuha is repentance by truly stopping the act of sin and not repeating it again, and trying to replace it with good deeds.
text.18:
The Oneness of Allah is declared by establishing proofs and through the evidence of His creation in the universe and within humanity, as well as by revealing verses that explain it. The angels also declare the Oneness of Allah and convey it to the prophets. The prophets declare a testimony strengthened by knowledge that is ingrained in their souls, which is higher than other knowledge acquired through experience. Likewise, the scholars also declare the Oneness of Allah and explain it. They witness Allah with a testimony accompanied by evidence and scientific reasons. This verse demonstrates the high status of the scholars because they have been equated with the noble angels, both being able to witness the Oneness of Allah.

"Establishing justice" means establishing balance in belief, because *tauhid* (monotheism) is a straight belief, pure *tauhid* that is not mixed with any denial of Allah or associating partners with Him. It also means establishing balance in worship, character, and deeds, meaning establishing balance between spiritual strength and physical strength. Allah commands us to perform the *salat* (prayer) and other acts of worship to purify the spirit. Allah tells us to eat good food to maintain the body. Allah forbids us from excessiveness in religion and extremism in loving the world.

Similarly, Allah has placed the law of balance in this universe. Whoever observes this natural law and its order carefully, the law of balance will appear most perfect to him. Allah establishes perfect balance in this universe as concrete evidence of the truth of His wisdom. The unity of order in this universe demonstrates the Oneness of its Creator.

At the end of this verse, the Oneness of His Essence is affirmed in the attributes of divinity. "There is no god but He, the Almighty, the All-Wise." The attribute "Almighty" in this verse gives an understanding of the perfection of His power, and the attribute "All-Wise" indicates the perfection of His knowledge. Power cannot be perfect except with the absolute right to act. Justice (balance) also cannot be perfect except by knowing all circumstances and benefits. So whoever's perfection has reached such a level, no one can influence Him in carrying out that balance, and no creature escapes His law.
text.19:
The religion recognized by Allah is only Islam, the religion of *tauhid*, the religion that affirms the oneness of Allah. He explains that the only valid religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. All religions and laws brought by previous prophets essentially have one core, which is "Islam," that is, submission to Allah, the One and Only, upholding His commands and humbling oneself before Him, even though the laws differ in some obligatory acts of worship and others.

A true Muslim is one who is sincere in carrying out all his deeds, has strong faith, and is free from *shirk*.

Allah legislated religion for two purposes:

1.  To purify the human soul and mind from incorrect beliefs.

2.  To improve the human soul with good deeds and purify sincerity to Allah.

Then Allah describes the disagreements of the People of the Book about the true religion. Actually, they would not have deviated from the religion of Islam, the religion of *tauhid* brought by the prophets, if their leaders had not acted unjustly and transgressed, causing them to split into several sects and kill the prophets. Division and war among them should not have occurred because they were one religion. But because of envy among their leaders, and their support for one *mazhab* to defeat another, that division arose. The division became more intense after the leaders misled their opponents by interpreting religious texts according to their desires.

At the end of this verse, a warning is given to those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah by emphasizing the punishment that will be inflicted upon them.
text.20:
In this verse, it is explained how the Prophet Muhammad should face the attitude of the People of the Book who oppose the religion of Islam. In facing them, the Prophet was commanded to respond when they raised objections to the teachings he brought, by saying to them that he only submits himself to Allah, as do those who follow him. This response is to avoid fruitless debates, because the evidence of their errors is already clear.

Then Allah commanded the Prophet to say to the Jews, Christians, and Arab polytheists he was facing: "Have you (decided to) enter Islam?" Meaning, do you want to accept the religion of Islam so that you submit yourselves to Allah. The Prophet conveyed this question after he had repeatedly shown evidence of its truth, and which they actually already understood. Or do they actually still want to continue their disbelief and resistance. Indirectly, the Prophet's question shows their ignorance and dullness of mind, and criticizes their stubborn attitude.

"Indeed, if they become Muslims, they are [rightly] guided." Becoming Muslim means submitting oneself absolutely to the Oneness of Allah. Herein lies the soul of all religions brought by the messengers, namely, submitting to Allah, the One and Only. They will surely obtain great benefit and be saved from the abyss of misery. Because their submission to Allah, the One and Only, will encourage them to follow the teachings brought by the Prophet Muhammad, namely the teachings of Islam. But if they refuse, then it is not his responsibility, because his duty is only to convey the teachings of Allah.

"And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants." Allah is All-Knowing of whose hearts are closed among His servants, whose eyes are blind to seeing the truth, and who are despairing of seeking divine guidance. Allah is All-Knowing of who among His servants can receive *tawfiq* and *hidayah* from Him.
text.21:
In this verse, Allah condemns the attitude of the Jews in the time of the prophets before Prophet Muhammad, who blindly followed the actions of their ancestors. Even though they actually knew the mistakes and evils of their ancestors.

With the explanation of this verse, the wickedness of the Jews becomes even clearer. It is difficult for them to find a reason to cleanse themselves by claiming to believe. Their proven crimes in history cause them to receive reproach and curses.

The Jews in the time of Rasulullah saw (peace be upon him) are considered to be complicit, because they did not show disapproval of the evils of their ancestors. In addition to killing the prophets, the Jews of the past also killed the *hukama'* (wise people), who are referred to in this verse as "those who enjoin justice." They consisted of intellectuals, who made justice the pillar of virtue.

The rank of the *hukama'* in providing guidance is below the rank of the prophets, and so is their influence. Killing the *hukama'* means killing reason and destroying justice. This is a great sin and very detrimental. Therefore, Allah warns the Jews that they will receive a painful punishment in this world and in the hereafter. Who is more deserving of receiving that painful punishment if not those who are cruel and transgress the limits in committing evil, such as killing the prophets and the intellectuals?
text.22:
In this verse, it is affirmed that those who commit evil deeds will have all their deeds performed in the world nullified. In the world, they will not receive praise from people, because they are in error and falsehood. Allah curses them, and exposes the evils they conceal through His prophets and messengers. Such is the meaning of the nullification of their deeds in the world.

As for the Hereafter, they will not receive reward for all their deeds, but will instead be plunged into a painful torment. They will eventually inhabit hell. No one will be able to help them from the pressure of Allah's torment.

Allah has erased the reward of the murderers of prophets and the wise who uphold justice, and eliminated for them help from anyone. Those murderers will be repaid with infinite torment and no one will be able to help them.

Allah has prepared three kinds of torment for them:

a. All pain and misery are gathered upon them. This is the painful torment.

b. All kinds of blessings they hope for vanish, with the erasure of the reward for the deeds they performed in the world. In the world they are cursed and reviled, and in the Hereafter they suffer.

c. Continuously suffering the torment, because no one will help release them from the torment. This is what Allah means in the verse which translates to "and they will have no helpers."
text.23: They turned away from practicing the book they themselves believed in whenever that book did not align with their desires. This was the behavior of the followers of Judaism during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him). The Jews came to the Messenger of Allah with a strong desire to receive a decision. But if the decision given did not align with what they wanted, they refused to implement it. They only memorized a portion of the contents of the Torah, while they forgot the rest. The portion they memorized, they did not understand well, nor did they practice it.
text.24:
This verse explains the reason or cause that drives the Jews to oppose and turn away from the truth. They have a concept deeply ingrained in their belief that they will not be punished by the fire of hell except for a few specific days.

This deeply ingrained assumption permeates their souls, and eventually shapes their mental attitude. So they take lightly the punishment that will befall them. This is because they feel a blood relationship with the prophets, and believe that they will be saved from the torment of hellfire as long as they remain Jewish. So according to their understanding, a lineage connection with a prophet, and remaining recorded as followers of the Jewish religion, already guarantees entry into paradise.

Whoever takes lightly the threat of Allah, because they believe that the punishment will not befall them, means they have underestimated Allah's commands and prohibitions.

Such is the state of a people, when they begin to abandon their religion, they are no longer hesitant to commit evil. This symptom of turning away from religion is evident among the Jews, Christians, and also among Muslims.

The Jews think that if they enter hell, they will only be punished for "a few days that can be counted," namely 40 days; the number of days they used to worship the calf. In reality, there is no reliable information to confirm when the days in question are, except for the empty assumptions of the Jews.

All the lies they have fabricated have deceived them in religion, for example their saying, "We are the children of God and His beloved," and their words, "Indeed, our ancestors, the prophets, will intercede for us," and "Indeed, Allah has promised Jacob that He will not punish his descendants, except for a short period."
text.25:
This verse refutes and nullifies what the Jews said in the previous verse. This verse is structured as a question: what will be the state of the Jews when the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, has come?

Such a sentence structure illustrates the magnitude of the chaos that will occur on that day, and the great torment that will be inflicted upon the Jews. They will fall into an abyss of suffering, with no way to save themselves. Indeed, the Jewish assumption that they will be able to easily escape the punishment is a mere empty dream.

On that terrible day, people will clearly see what they have done, good or bad, it will be presented to them. Then all deeds will be rewarded with happiness if the deeds are good, or with misery if the deeds are bad. No special privileges can be given to adherents of a particular religion or a particular group. Nor does any nation receive special privileges over other nations, even if they call themselves *sha'bullah al-mukhtar* (the chosen people of God) or children of God. The recompense on the Day of Resurrection will be in accordance with the goodness or badness of the belief contained in the heart and in accordance with the goodness or badness of the deeds that have been done.

On that day there will be perfect justice. The reward for an action will not be reduced in the slightest, nor will it be increased. What will be considered on that day is a person's faith and the influence of that faith on his deeds while in the world. If he does not believe, then he will enter hell, because of his bad deeds. If his faith is not completely ruined, because it is balanced by good deeds or there is a balance between good and bad, then he will receive a reward according to his respective degree and measure.
text.26:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet to declare that Allah, the Most Holy, possesses the highest authority and is Most Wise in His perfect actions in arranging, managing, and completing all matters, and in establishing the scales of law in this universe. Thus, Allah grants the affairs of governance to whomever He wills among His servants. Sometimes Allah grants this power along with the rank of prophethood, like the family of Ibrahim, and sometimes He only grants the power to govern according to social law, namely by regulating tribes and nations. Allah also removes power from those He wills, because they turn away from the straight path, which is the path that can preserve power by abandoning justice and acting corruptly in governance. Thus, this has also happened to the Children of Israel and other nations because of their injustice and moral corruption.

Allah also gives power to whom He wills, and humiliates whom He wills. The one given power is the one whose words are heeded, has many helpers, influences people's souls with authority and knowledge, has abundant sustenance, and does good to all people.

As for the one who receives humiliation, it is the one who is low in morals, feels weak in spirit to defend honor, is unable to drive away his attacking enemies, and is unable to unite his followers. Whereas no glory can be achieved without unity to uphold truth and oppose injustice.

When a society is united and walks according to *sunnatullah* (Allah's laws), it means they have prepared everything to face all possibilities. The large or small number of a people does not guarantee the ability to realize power and gather strength. The polytheists of Mecca, the Jews, and the Arab hypocrites were deceived by the large number of their followers compared to the followers of the Messenger of Allah (saw), even though that did not bring them any benefit whatsoever. As Allah says:

"They say, "If we return to Madinah, the more honored [among us] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." But honor [belonging to power] is [due] to Allah and to His Messenger and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know." (al-Munafiqun/63: 8)

Historical facts prove that a large number alone does not indicate strength. Look at the Eastern nations, they are numerous but can be controlled by Western nations that are fewer in number, due to the rampant ignorance and hostility, or the divisions that occur among themselves.

In this verse, it is also explained that all goodness lies in His hands, whether it be prophethood, power, or wealth. This shows that Allah alone gives it according to His will. No one possesses goodness except Allah. In this verse, only goodness is mentioned. Actually, everything bad and evil is also under the power of Allah. This is understood from Allah's statement that He is All-Powerful over all things.

In this verse, only goodness is mentioned because it is adapted to the situation. The situation that encouraged the disbelievers to oppose and underestimate the *da'wah* (call) of the Prophet Muhammad (saw) was his poverty, the weakness of his followers, and their small number. Therefore, Allah commands the Prophet to seek refuge in the One who possesses all kingdoms, in whose hands is all power and glory. Allah reminds the Messenger that all goodness and wealth are in His hands. So, nothing can prevent Him if Allah gives poverty and wealth to His Prophet or to the believers He wills, as Allah explains in His word:

"And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors." (al-Qasas/28: 5)
text.27:
The night is inserted into the day, making the night shorter than the day. Allah inserts the day into the night, causing the night to be long and the day to be short. This usually happens in countries that have four seasons, so the night is longer than the day in winter.

It is not surprising that after this reality, Allah, the All-Wise, gives prophethood or kingship to whomever He wills, or takes away prophethood and kingship from whomever He wills. Allah manages all human affairs, just as He manages the changes of day and night.

Allah brings forth the living from the dead, such as bringing forth a coconut tree from its seed, bringing forth humans from a sperm drop, or bringing forth a bird from an egg. Likewise, Allah brings forth the dead from the living, such as bringing forth a foolish child from a knowledgeable person, or a disbeliever from a believer.

Allah's power is also explained in easy-to-understand language, with examples that can be witnessed by humans in everyday events. Night is inserted into day, day is inserted into night, living plants are brought forth from the soil which is a dead object, an egg which is a dead object, from a chicken which is a living creature.

The verse above speaks about plant seeds and about "bringing forth the living from the dead and bringing forth the dead from the living." Another similar and even clearer verse is Surah al-An'am/6: 95, which means:

"Indeed, Allah is the one who causes the seed grain and the date stone to split and sprout. He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living. That is Allah; then how are you deluded?" (al-An'am/6: 95)

From a scientific point of view, these things can be interpreted as follows:

1. This verse contains the message that creation is not a coincidence, because if it were a coincidence, it could not be continuous. Creation occurs in two contradictory things. Whoever can do that must be the Almighty. The phrase "bringing forth the living from the dead" states Allah's power to resurrect the dead on the Day of Judgment. But the resurrection of the dead into life and vice versa is also seen in everyday events in the process of plant seed development.

2. The second interpretation is that seeds are used as an example in regulating the cycle between life and death that continues to roll.

ï‚§How seeds exemplify this cycle is as follows. For plants, seeds are the main means of reproduction, because seeds contain a new plant embryo. With these seeds, plants can maintain their offspring and spread them to other places. In plant morphology, there are known closed seeds called Angiosperms, and naked/open seeds called Gymnosperms. Seeds have diversity in size, shape with multi-layered seed coats, and hardness (from soft to hard as stone). When the seed reaches the necessary conditions, the seed will grow and the seed coat that protects the part of the seed inside will be penetrated by the embryo. Even the seed coat layer as hard as stone can be broken.

ï‚§The cycle of life and death is a secret of natural wonders and the secret of life. The main characteristic of the cycle is that non-organic substances of hydrogen, carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and salts on earth, are transformed into organic substances which are the building blocks of life for animals and plants with the help of sunlight. Furthermore, these substances die again in the form of living things' waste and in the form of bodies that are worn out due to bacterial and chemical dissolution factors, which transform them into non-organic substances to enter a new life cycle. That is how the Creator brings forth life from death and brings forth death from life at every moment. This cycle continues to spin and only occurs in creatures that are given life.

The Qur'an also uses the word "dead" to mean "disbeliever," and the word "alive" to mean "faith" as in:

And is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus it has been made pleasing to the disbelievers that which they were doing. (al-An'am/6: 122)

The word "alive" is used in the sense of the opposite of "dead," whether the life is á¸¥issiyyah such as the life of animals and plants or maknawiyyah such as knowledge and faith. "The living is brought forth from the dead" and so on is a reality, that Allah has the power that He gives to whomever He wills. Allah brought forth a leader of the prophets from the illiterate Arabs. That Messenger, Muhammad saw, prepared them with strength and will to become the strongest people, who could destroy the fortresses of slavery and establish independence. Meanwhile, the Jews (Bani Israil) wallowed in taqlid, slavery and oppression of kings or rulers.

Allah gives power to whomever He wills, then takes away His gift from whomever He wills, only based on His sunnah and law. All matters are in Allah's hands. No one can assess and estimate His calculations. He is the one who has the power to take power from whomever He wills and humiliate them, and only He has the power to give that power to a nation and glorify it. That is very easy for Allah. Allah gives sustenance to whomever He wills without recompense.
text.28:
Muslims are prohibited from taking disbelievers as close friends, leaders, or helpers, because this will harm them in matters of religion and the interests of the ummah, especially if the interests of the disbelievers are prioritized over the interests of the Muslims themselves, as this will help spread disbelief. This is strictly forbidden in Islam.

Believers are prohibited from having close relationships with disbelievers, whether due to kinship, old friendships from the time of ignorance (jahiliyah), or neighborhood ties. This prohibition is solely to safeguard and maintain the well-being of the religion, and to prevent Muslims from being hindered in their efforts to achieve the goals desired by their religion.

However, forms of friendship and cooperative agreements that can guarantee the well-being of Muslims are not prohibited. The Prophet himself once made a friendship agreement with the Bani Khuza'ah, even though they were still polytheists.

It is then stated that whoever takes disbelievers as helpers, abandoning the believers, in matters that harm the religion, has renounced the guardianship of Allah, is disobedient to Allah, and does not help His religion. This also means that his faith in Allah has been severed, and he has become one of the disbelievers.

¦ Whoever among you takes them as allies, then surely he is one of them ¦ (al-Ma'idah/5: 51)

A believer may have a close relationship with a disbeliever, fearing harm or to provide benefit to Muslims. It is not forbidden for an Islamic government to make friendship agreements with non-Islamic governments, with the intention of warding off harm or obtaining benefits. The permissibility of having this friendship is not only in a state of weakness but also at any time, according to the principle:

Repelling harm takes precedence over bringing benefit.

Based on this principle, scholars permit "taqiyah," which is saying or doing something contrary to the truth to ward off disaster from the enemy or for the safety of life or to preserve honor and property.

So whoever utters words of disbelief because he is forced, while his heart (soul) remains believing, in order to protect himself from destruction, then he does not become a disbeliever. As was done by 'Ammar bin Yasir who was forced by the Quraysh to become a disbeliever, while his heart remained believing. Allah says:

Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief - upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment. (an-Nahl/16: 106)

As happened to a companion who was cornered when answering Musailamah's question, "Do you acknowledge that I am the messenger of Allah?" He answered, "Yes." Because of that, the companion was left alone and not killed. Then another companion, when asked the same question, answered, "I am deaf" (three times), so the companion was arrested and killed. After this news reached the Messenger of Allah (saw), he said: "The one who was killed returned to Allah with his conviction and honesty, as for the other, he has used the leniency given by Allah, therefore there is no blame on him."

This leniency is due to the emergency situation faced, and does not concern the fundamentals of religion that must always be obeyed. In this case, it is obligatory for a Muslim to migrate from a place where he cannot carry out the commands of religion and is forced to practice "taqiyyah" in that place. It is a sign of the perfection of faith if a person is not afraid of reproach in carrying out the religion of Allah. Allah says:

¦..so do not fear them but fear Me, if you are [true] believers.¦ (Ali 'Imran/3: 175)

Allah says:

...So do not fear the people but fear Me. ¦. (al-Ma'idah/5: 44).

Included in "taqiyah" is being kind, gentle to disbelievers, oppressors, and evildoers, and giving them wealth to ward off their harm. This is not the close friendship that is forbidden, but rather a way that is in accordance with the guidance of the rule:

"An action that can preserve the honor of a believer is included in charity." (Narrated by ath-Thabrani).

In another hadith from Aisyah r.a.:

A person came asking for permission to meet the Messenger of Allah and at that time I was beside him. Then the Messenger of Allah said, "(He is) the worst of the people of this community." Then the Messenger of Allah allowed him to come forward, then he spoke to that person with friendliness and gentleness. The Messenger of Allah said, "O 'Aisyah, indeed among the worst people is the one who is abandoned by others because of fear of his evil." (Narrated by al-Bukhari)

To those who violate Allah's prohibition above, Allah warns them with punishment directly from His side and no one can prevent it. Finally, to Allah is the place of return for all creatures. Everyone will get a reward according to their deeds.
text.29:
Allah knows everything contained within the heart of a Muslim when they establish a close relationship with a disbeliever. Whether it is because they are fond of the disbeliever, or it is done with the intention of saving themselves. If a Muslim does this because they are inclined towards disbelief, then Allah will surely punish them. But if they do it to protect themselves and their hearts remain firm in faith, Allah will forgive them and will not punish them for actions that do not harm the religion and the ummah. Allah rewards them according to His own knowledge, which encompasses all that is in the heavens and the earth.

At the end of this verse, Allah says that: "Allah is All-Powerful over all things." Therefore, O Muslims, do not dare to disobey Him and do not cooperate with His enemies. All forms of disobedience, both hidden and apparent, are always known to Allah, and He has the power to give retribution for them.
text.30:
Furthermore, in this verse, Allah warns of the Day that will surely come, when every human being will witness for themselves all their deeds during their lifetime. Those who receive the reward for their good deeds will feel happy and joyful for the reward they receive. People will also witness their evil deeds and wish that those evil deeds were kept far away from them. Then, Allah repeats His threat by warning mankind against His punishment, that is, mankind should fear Allah's wrath by doing good deeds, rejecting the deceptions of Satan, and repenting to Him. Then this verse is concluded with the statement that Allah is Most Compassionate to His servants.

Al-Hasan al-Basri said, "Among Allah's compassion is that He warns mankind of His power, introducing to them the perfection of His knowledge and ability, because whoever knows this perfectly will surely feel called to seek His pleasure and avoid His wrath. Among Allah's mercy is: Allah makes human nature inclined towards goodness and always hates things that lead to evil, so that the influence of evil in the soul can be eliminated through repentance and good deeds."
text.31:
In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet to say to the Jews that if they are truly obedient to Allah, then they should acknowledge the prophethood of Prophet Muhammad, by implementing everything contained in the revelation that Allah has sent down to him. If they have done so, then Allah will surely be pleased with them and forgive all the mistakes they have made and pardon their sins. Following the Messenger sincerely, both in belief and righteous deeds, will eliminate the impact of their disobedience and the vileness of their souls, and erase the injustices they committed previously.

This verse provides strong evidence to refute the claims of those who claim to love Allah at all times, while their actions contradict those words. How can love for Allah and turning away from His commands coexist in a person? Whoever loves Allah but does not follow the path and guidance of the Messenger of Allah, then that claim of love is false and a lie. The Messenger of Allah said:

"Whoever performs an action that is not based on our command, then that action is rejected." (Narrated by al-Bukhari).

Whoever loves Allah with full obedience, and draws closer to Him by following the commands of His Prophet, and purifies himself with righteous deeds, then Allah will forgive his sins.
text.32:
It is narrated that when the Prophet Muhammad saw, conveyed verse 31 above, Abdullah bin Ubay said, "Muhammad has equated obedience to him with obedience to Allah, and he commands us to love him as the Christians love Isa." Then Allah revealed this verse 32.

The meaning of this verse is, "Say to them, O Muhammad. Obey Allah by following all His commands and avoiding all His prohibitions. Obey the Messenger of Allah by following his Sunnah, and make his guidance as a (guideline) in life." This verse also gives the understanding that Allah swt obligates us to follow the Prophet Muhammad saw, because he is the Messenger of Allah.

If those disbelievers turn away and refuse to accept the call of the Messenger because of their claim that they are the children of Allah and His beloved ones, then indeed Allah does not like the disbelievers, that is, those who have been diverted by their desires from the verses of Allah. Therefore, Allah is not pleased with them, even distancing them from the pleasures of His Paradise and will be angry with them on the Day of Judgment.
text.33:
Allah has chosen Adam and the family of Ibrahim, as well as the family of Imran, and made them chosen people in their respective times, and given them prophethood and messengership.

Adam was the first messenger as the father of all mankind, whom Allah chose as a Prophet.

Then his Lord chose him, and He accepted his repentance and guided him. (Taha/20: 122)

From the descendants of Adam, prophets and messengers were born. The second messenger was Noah, as the second father of mankind, although there is an opinion that Noah was the first messenger. In his time, a great flood occurred that destroyed most of mankind. Allah saved him and some of his family from that terrible disaster in an ark. Many of his descendants became prophets and messengers. Then his descendants spread to several countries.

Then came Ibrahim as a prophet and messenger. After Ibrahim came a succession of prophets and messengers from his descendants, such as Ismail, Isaac, Jacob and Asbath (grandchildren of the Children of Israel). Among the prominent descendants of Prophet Ibrahim are: the family of Ismail, and the family of Imran, namely Isa and his mother, Maryam binti Imran, a descendant of Jacob.

Then prophethood was sealed with a son from the descendants of Prophet Ismail, namely Muhammad saw.
text.34: Both families - the family of Abraham and the family of Imran are one lineage that branched out into several lineages. The descendants of Abraham are "Ishmael and Isaac." Abraham himself is a descendant of Prophet Noah, and Prophet Noah came from Prophet Adam. The family of Imran, namely Moses, Aaron, Jesus and his mother, are grandchildren of Prophet Abraham.
text.35:
